content: Now that we have llvm-based source coverage support, I think it would be interesting to use it on the compiler itself. We could generate one .profraw file for each test file in src/test/ui, and combine them to get a coverage report for the compiler itself
Getting even fancier, we could integrate this with our github-actions workflow to something like coveralls or codecov
Hi @Aaron Hill , I've been trying to do this but run into some errors. Have you been able to run -Z instrument-coverage on the compiler itself?
